choices.B: You must login with your company's social network account to work with social accounts.
choices.D: Social accounts allow you to manage your company's social media from within Salesforce.

questions.question_text: Which is true about encrypted fields?

choices.A: A custom field can be converted to an encrypted field.
choices.C: Encrypted fields can be converted to other field types.
choices.B: They are available in Validation Rules or Apex Scripts even if the user is not having the permission "View Encrypted Data".
choices.D: In Email Templates, if an encrypted field needs to be displayed without the mask character, the User who receives the email should have the View Encrypted Data permission.

discussion.content:
B - You can still validate the values of encrypted fields using validation rules or Apex. Both work regardless of whether the user has the View Encrypted Data permission.

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.fields_about_encrypted_fields.htm&type=5

questions.question_text: Which three statements are true about Master-Detail relationships? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CDE
Salesforce will not accommodate a master detail relationship to a custom object that already contains data.
This is because creating a master-detail relationship adds a new required field to the custom object (known as a "foreign key" to database administrators)
